{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3607381,"name":null,"username":"Kabinet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kabinet/{size}/244566_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-29T16:46:57.462Z","cooked":"

The CTRE docs mention that status signals in the same frame use the highest refresh rate specified by any signal in that frame, but try as I might, there is no documentation anywhere on what the contents of each status frame actually are. Is there a list of them somewhere?

Phoenix 6

Status Signals

Phoenix 6 expands the functionality of status signals with the introduction of the StatusSignal( Java, C++). Using Status Signals:,, v5,, Java C++,, v6,, Java C++,,,, Changing Update Frequency (Sta...

(Mentioned on this page)

I think the status frames are completely abstracted away from the user in Phoenix 6. I’d probably just set the frequency of the signals you care about, call optimizeBusUtilization(), and not worry about it too much.

This enum in the Phoenix 5 API might give some info if you do want to dig deeper: StatusFrameEnhanced (CTRE Phoenix Java 5.35.1)
